page.title: 12The Miners' Strike
page.content: In March 1984 there was a National Strike called by the National Union of Miners.The reason for the strike was the fear of many pit closures.Askern Colliery was one of the collieries to join the strike.The strike affected not only the people who worked at the pit but the majority of the population in one way or another.Many businesses suffered along with the miners from lack of money.During the strike there was trouble in Askern and other mining communities because of the number of men returning to work which caused picket line violence.The men who broke the strike were called scabs they had violence shown not only to themselves but to their families and property.
